Breeding adult.description: Breeding Red-throated Loons have a solid black back and a red throat whereas breeding Pacific Loons have a barred back and a black throat.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Nonbreeding Red-throated Loons have more extensive white on the face and neck than nonbreeding/immature Pacific Loons. They also hold their bills up while Pacific Loons hold their bill straight.

Breeding adult.description: Common Loons have a thicker bill than Pacific Loons. They have a checkered back and striped collar whereas Pacific Loons have a barred back and vertical striping on the neck.

Nonbreeding/immature.description: Nonbreeding/immature Common Loons are larger with a thicker bill. They also have a jagged collar around the neck while the neck on nonbreeding Pacific Loons is smooth.

Breeding.description: Arctic Loon is nearly identical, but has a flatter crown and a white patch at the rear that Pacific Loons lack. Arctic Loons are rarely encountered in the Lower 48.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Nonbreeding Arctic Loon lacks a "chinstrap" like nonbreeding Pacific Loons. They also show more extensive white on the sides than Pacific Loons.
Double-crested Cormorants have a longer neck and do not have white on the neck like nonbreeding Pacific Loons.
